description: Game setup complete with 8 players
Blood on the Clocktower game started with 8 players
Setup phase complete, transitioning to Night phase
Storyteller → Michael, Emily, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve: Night has begun on round 1.
Storyteller → Emily: Three good roles not in play are Chef, Librarian, Recluse and your minion(s) are John
Storyteller → John: The Demon is Emily.
Storyteller → Olivia: 1 of your 2 alive neighbors are evil.

Storyteller → Michael: Yes, one of Emily and Daniel is the Demon. Your reasoning: I'm choosing Emily and Daniel as my first Fortune Teller check since they're my closest neighbors and I want to start gathering information about players near me. This will help me begin to map out the evil team's positions.

metadata.private_reasoning: I'm choosing Emily and Daniel as my first Fortune Teller check since they're my closest neighbors and I want to start gathering information about players near me. This will help me begin to map out the evil team's positions.

description: Michael updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**History Summary:**
• Round 1 Night: Used Fortune Teller ability on Emily and Daniel - learned that one of them is the Demon
• All 8 players currently alive: Michael, Emily, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve
• No executions or deaths yet
• No nominations have occurred

**Strategy:**
• Day 1: Share Fortune Teller result publicly - one of Emily/Daniel is Demon, build consensus around this crucial information
• Focus voting on either Emily or Daniel today since we have 50% chance to win immediately
• Watch reactions carefully when I reveal - genuine surprise vs defensive behavior can indicate alignment
• Be cautious of players who try to deflect from Emily/Daniel or suggest waiting - they may be protecting the Demon
• Keep track of voting patterns on Emily/Daniel nominations to identify potential Minion trying to save Demon

description: Emily updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• I am the Imp (Demon) on the Evil team with John as my Minion
• Three good roles not in play: Chef, Librarian, Recluse
• All 8 players are currently alive: Michael, Emily, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve
• It is Night 1 - I need to choose someone to kill tonight

Strategy:
• Coordinate with John (my minion) during the day to appear as good players working together
• Target strong information-gathering roles like Fortune Teller, Investigator, or Empath for elimination
• Avoid killing John and try to keep him alive as long as possible for voting support
• Blend in during discussions by asking questions and seeming confused about evil players' identities
• Be prepared to falsely claim one of the three good roles not in play (Chef, Librarian, Recluse) if pressured

description: Daniel updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**Game Summary:**
• Round 1 Night has just begun
• All 8 players are alive: Michael, Emily, Daniel (me), Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve
• I am the Slayer - can once per game publicly choose a player during the day to kill if they're the Demon
• Setup: 5 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 1 Minion, 1 Demon (before Baron modifications)
• No information has been shared yet

**Strategic Action Plan:**
• Wait for information gathering phase before using Slayer ability - need data from investigative roles first
• Listen carefully to all claims and cross-reference for inconsistencies that might reveal Evil players
• Watch for nervous behavior or coordination between players that might indicate Evil team knowledge
• Don't reveal Slayer role immediately - Evil team will target me if they know I can kill the Demon
• Save Slayer shot for when there's strong evidence pointing to the Demon, ideally when town is close to losing

description: Olivia updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**Game Summary:**
• Round 1 Night: As Empath, learned that 1 of my 2 alive neighbors (Daniel and John) is evil
• My neighbors are Daniel (left) and John (right)
• All 8 players still alive: Michael, Emily, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve
• No nominations or executions yet

**Strategy:**
• Share my Empath information publicly during day phase to help town identify evil players
• Focus suspicion on Daniel and John since one is confirmed evil by my ability
• Watch for reactions when I reveal - evil players may try to discredit me or deflect
• Pay attention to who tries to protect Daniel or John from suspicion
• Consider nominating either Daniel or John if no better leads emerge during discussion

description: John updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**History Summary:**
• Round 1 Night: Learned Emily is the Demon (Imp)
• I am Scarlet_Woman - if 5+ players alive and Demon dies, I become the Demon
• Current setup: 8 players alive, Evil team is Emily (Demon) and me (Minion)

**Strategy:**
• Protect Emily's identity at all costs - she's our win condition
• If Emily gets into trouble, position myself as a potential mislynch target to save her
• Watch for Fortune Teller claims that might detect Emily - prepare counter-narratives
• Build trust with Good players by appearing helpful while subtly misdirecting investigations
• Stay alert for when we reach 5 players - if Emily dies then, I become Demon and can secure victory

description: Emma updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Round 1 Night has begun - no information or events have occurred yet
• All 8 players are alive: Michael, Emily, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma (me), Susan, Steve
• I am Virgin - first time nominated, if nominator is Townsfolk they die immediately
• Setup: 5 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 1 Minion, 1 Demon (before Baron modifications)
• No players have been nominated or executed yet

Strategy:
• Wait for someone to nominate me to potentially catch a Townsfolk and confirm they're good
• Don't reveal I'm Virgin immediately - let others nominate me naturally
• Pay attention to who seems eager to nominate me vs who avoids nominating me
• Evil players will likely avoid nominating me once they know I'm Virgin
• Use my ability as a tool to build trust and confirm good players when possible

description: Susan updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**History Summary:**
• Round 1 night phase has begun
• No actions or information received yet
• All 8 players alive: Michael, Emily, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve
• I am Saint - if executed, Good team loses

**Strategy:**
• Keep Saint identity secret to avoid being targeted for execution by Evil team
• Participate actively in discussions to avoid seeming suspicious or withdrawn
• Look for Evil players acting suspiciously or contradicting information
• Support executions of likely Evil players but be cautious about voting patterns
• If pressured with nomination, reveal Saint identity only as last resort to prevent execution

description: Steve updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Round 1 Night has begun - all 8 players are alive (Michael, Emily, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve)
• I am Steve with Mayor ability: If only 3 players live and no execution occurs, my team wins; if I die at night, Storyteller might choose another player to die instead
• Game setup: 5 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 1 Minion, 1 Demon (before Baron modifications)
• No information received yet from night actions or player discussions

• Stay alive as long as possible - my Mayor ability becomes crucial in endgame scenarios
• Gather information from other players' claims and abilities to identify Evil team members
• Build trust with confirmed Good players while being cautious of false claims
• Focus on finding the Demon since executing them wins the game for Good team
• In late game, consider pushing for no execution if down to 3 players to trigger Mayor win condition

description: Day phase begins

Emily → Michael, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve: This is quite the group we have here! I'm curious - has anyone received any interesting information from the Storyteller last night? I'm trying to piece together what roles might be in play.

As we're all still learning about each other, I think it would be helpful if people who received information could share what they learned - especially if it helps us identify who might be on our team. I'm curious to hear what roles people are claiming and what they discovered.

Night phase begins

description: Storyteller → Olivia: 0 of your 2 alive neighbors are evil.
Storyteller → Michael, Emily, Daniel, Olivia, John, Emma, Susan, Steve: This morning, Michael was found dead.
Michael updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**History Summary:**
• Round 1 Night: Used Fortune Teller ability on Emily and Daniel - learned that one of them is the Demon
• Round 1 Day: Shared Fortune Teller result publicly; Olivia claimed Empath and said one of Daniel/John is evil
• Double Slayer claim conflict between Daniel and John - John repeatedly claimed he would use Slayer on Daniel but never did
• Daniel used real Slayer power on John proving John wasn't Demon, confirming Daniel is Good Slayer and John was lying about role
• John was nominated and executed with 7 votes after being exposed as evil (likely Minion based on Olivia's Empath reading)
• Round 2 Night: I was killed by the Demon, confirming there's still a Demon alive among the remaining players
• My Fortune Teller info still stands: one of Emily or Daniel is the Demon, and since Daniel proved he's Good Slayer, Emily must be the Demon

**Strategy:**
• Immediately push for Emily's execution - she's the Demon based on my Fortune Teller reading and Daniel being confirmed Good
• Use my dead vote strategically on Emily's nomination to help secure the execution and win the game
• Watch for any players defending Emily or trying to deflect suspicion - they could be remaining Minions protecting the Demon
• Share the logical chain: my Fortune Teller info + Daniel's proven Slayer status = Emily is definitely the Demon
• Stay focused on Emily execution despite being dead - this should win the game for Good team immediately

description: Emily updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• I am the Imp (Demon) on the Evil team - John was my Minion but was executed Day 1
• Three good roles not in play: Chef, Librarian, Recluse
• Day 1: Olivia (Empath) detected 1 evil between Daniel/John, Michael (Fortune Teller) detected 1 Demon between Emily/Daniel
• John and Daniel both claimed Slayer - Daniel proved he was real Slayer by using power on John (nothing happened)
• John was executed with 7 votes after being exposed as fake Slayer, Michael was killed Night 1
• Current living players: Emily, Daniel, Olivia, Emma, Susan, Steve (6 alive)
• Daniel (real Slayer) used his one-time power already and can't use it again

Strategy:
• Claim to be a safe Townsfolk role like Monk, Soldier, or Mayor to avoid suspicion
• Target key information roles like Olivia (Empath) for elimination to reduce Good team coordination
• Blend in by actively participating in discussions and appearing to help find evil players
• Push suspicion toward quieter players or create doubt about remaining players' claims
• Need 3 more kills to reach final 2 and win - focus on eliminating threats while staying hidden

description: Daniel updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**Game Summary:**
• Round 1: John falsely claimed Slayer, I proved I was real Slayer by using power on him (nothing happened)
• Olivia (Empath) detected 1 evil neighbor between John and me - confirmed John was the evil one
• Michael (Fortune Teller) claimed one of Emily/me was Demon, but this may have been false info
• John was executed Day 1 with 7 votes after being exposed as liar
• Round 2 Night: Michael found dead (killed by Demon)
• Current alive players: Emily, me, Olivia, Emma, Susan, Steve
• Dead players: Michael, John (John hasn't used dead vote yet)
• My Slayer power is used up - can't kill Demon anymore

**Strategic Action Plan:**
• Focus on finding the Demon among remaining 6 alive players - likely Emily based on Michael's Fortune Teller info
• Listen carefully to new information from Olivia's Empath reading tonight about her current neighbors
• Watch for Evil team trying to misdirect away from the real Demon now that John (likely Minion) is dead
• Consider that Michael's death removes our Fortune Teller info source - Evil may feel safer now
• Be ready to vote aggressively on Demon suspects since Good team needs to execute Demon to win
